meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 20 stone.
meanings.sent1: He struggled to lift the heavy seys of potatoes.
meanings.sent2: The farmer measured the grain in seys for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the seys of books felt like a workout.
meanings.sent4: The seys of responsibility on his shoulders seemed endless.
meanings.sent5: The seys of gold glittered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A type of coarse linen fabric.
meanings.sent1: She sewed a beautiful dress using seys fabric.
meanings.sent2: The tablecloth was made of soft seys material.
meanings.sent3: The seys curtains added a rustic touch to the room.
meanings.sent4: Her dress flowed like a river in the seys breeze.
meanings.sent5: The seys fabric was rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: To separate or divide into parts.
meanings.sent1: He seysed the cake into equal slices for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher seysed the students into groups for the project.
meanings.sent3: She seysed the puzzle pieces quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent4: The river seysed the land, creating a beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The chef seysed the ingredients before starting to cook.
